***COOKS AND CHEFS, PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE RECIPE BEFORE BEGINNING- THIS IS A RECOMMENDED STEP WITH EVERY PRODUCT WE EVER PRODUCE- THANK YOU*** Amanda
Preps used in this Product recipe:
Allergens: (To be filled out by nutrition) Method:
1. In a large pot bring the water to a boil. Add the rice, lentils, bayleaf and 1/2 the salt. Bring back to a boil, turn heat down to medium and lid, leaving lid slightly ajar. Simmer for 30-35 minutes or until the rice and lentils are tender. Drain, reserving at least 1 1/4 C (281g) of cooking liquid (it will be used later to make the sauce). Place the rice and lentils back in their cooking pot, lid and set aside off heat.
2. *A note about the veggies. Be sure they're diced small, otherwise they'll be crunchy-ish at the end of cooking. We're looking for them to be soft.
3. In a large Rondeau add the oil and heat until shimmering. Add the bell pepper, onion and celery. Turn the heat to low. Stir. Cook, stirring occassionally for about 12-15 minutes. The veggies are done when the they're tender/soft and brown bits (fond – the brown bits that stick to the bottom of the pan) are just starting to appear in the pan.
4. To the pan of veggies, add the tomato paste, garlic, Cajun or Creole seasoning and remaining 1/2 salt. Stir to coa the veggies. Pour in 3/4 C (180g) of the reserved cooking liquid from the lentils and rice. Stir.
5. To the pan, add the drained kidney beans. Stir. Heat should be on medium-low to low. Lid the pan and gently cook the beans through for about 8-10 minutes. Check on the beans a few times while cooking and If needed, add just a bit more cooking liquid from the reserved liquid. Your beans should be saucy, and moist, not dry.
6. Turn the heat to low and transfer the drained rice and lentils to the bean mixture. Add Worcestershire sauce. Add the lemon juice and to taste for seasoning, adjust if necassary; then gently fold all the ingredients together. If needed, to loosen the mixture or if it starts to get too dry, add a splash of cooking liquid - you'll probably not use it all - thats okay. Taste for salt. Lid. Leave on low heat for 3-5 minutes just to warm though, checking to make sure it isn't sticking - the pan should be almost dry, with a moist (but not sticky) rice mixture.
HOT HOLD/SERVE
*Cool, store, label and rotate this item with older product correctly and diligently

1. Cut the potatoes in half

3. In a large tilt skillet over medium heat, cook diced bacon until crispy. Reserve about 2 tablespoons of fat in pan, and transfer bacon to a paper towel-lined plate to blot exess fat.
4. Add red onion and cook over medium heat until starting to soften, about 3 minutes. Whisk in in apple cider vinegar, water, olive oil, Dijon mustard, and sugar. Bring mixture to a simmer, then turn off heat and season with salt and pepper.
5. Toss in green onions and gradually pour mixture over potatoes.
6. Toss to combine and serve warm.

***COOKS AND CHEFS, PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE RECIPE BEFORE BEGINNING- THIS IS A RECOMMENDED STEP WITH EVERY PRODUCT WE EVER PRODUCE- THANK YOU*** Amanda
Related Products this prep gets used in:
Allergens: (to be filled out by nutrition) Method:
BUTTERNUT SQUASH FILLING:
* Process the squash;peel and remove seeds and pulp. Steam the squash untill fully cooked (fork tender) Using the robo coupe combine the squash untill pureed, mix in 350g of Ricota, milk,salt, and the nutmeg. Blend until creamy and smooth. Check for seasoning, adjust as needed.
SPINACH FILLING:
* steam out the spinach till vibrant green and wilted, squeeze out any exess moisture. Combine the cooked spinach, 350g of ricotta,150g of mozza, garlic, salt, and pepper. Mix together and taste for seasoning, adjust as needed.
COOK LASAGNA NOODLES TILL AL DENTE
ASSEMBLE:
1. In a hotel pan, LIGHTLY oil the bottom of the dish. spread 1/3 of the squash filling on the bottom of the pan. Sprinkle lightly with some of the reserved mozza,top with cooked lasagne noodles without overlaping.
2.spread half of the spinach mix over the noodles. sprinkle lightly with more mozza. Top with more cooked Noodles.
3. Spread another layer 1/3 of the squash mixture, sprinkle lightly with more mozza. Tope with cooked noodles
4.Spread the remaining half of the spinach mixture over the noodles. Sprinkle lightly with more mozza. Tope with noodles
5. Spread a generous amount of the squash filling (remaining 1/3) over the final layer of noodles top with remaining mozza and top with parmesan.
6. Sprinkle the oregano, paprika and basil.
7. Cover hotel pan with foil and bake @375 for 30 minutes; uncover and continue to bake for an aditional 10 minutes.
8. Allow to rest for at least 20 minutes before cutting to ensure a nice slice!
Hot hold/serve imediately.

Method:
1) Smash black peppercorns slightly.
2) Combine water, crushed black pepeprcorns, bay leaf, sugar, garlic cloves, onion, rosemary, thyme, salt and lemon (make sure to give the lemons a good squeeze before throwing in the mix)
3) Bring brine to a boil and stir to ensure that salt and sugar are dissolved. Put mixture in blast chiller to cool.
4) When brine has cooled COMPLETELY, add turkey breast. Ensure breasts stay in brine by weighing them down with a tray from the servery.
5) Allow breast to brine for 6 hours.
6) Roast in 325*F oven until browned and probe thermometer reaches 70*C (158*F).

Allergens: Method:
SHORTBREAD CRUST;
1. Preheat oven to 300F. Line hotel pan with parchment paper leaving over hang on all sides. Set aside.
2. Melt 115g of butter. In a bowl stir the melted butter, sugar, vanilla and salt together. Add the flour and mix untill everything is combined. Press the mixture evenly into the prepared pan. Bake for 15 minutes while its baking prepare the filling and streusel.
APPLE FILLING:
1. Peel and slice apples thinly (1/4 inch thick) Combine the sliced apples with flour, granulated sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg together in a large bowl until all the apple are evenly coated. Set aside.
STREUSEL TOPPING:
1. Combine the oats, Brown sugar, cinnamon, and flour together in a bowl. Cut in the cold butter(60g) until it resembles coarse brumbs. Set aside.
2. Remove the the base crust from the oven. Turn oven up to 350F. Evenly layer the seasoned apples on top of the warm crust. (it will seem like there are to many apples) layer them tightly and press down to fit/form.
3.Sprinkle the top of the apples with the sreussel topping and bake for 30-35 minutes untill streussel is golden brown.
4. Remove from oven and allow to cool for at least 20 minutes at room temp, then chill in the cooler for at least 2 hours (or overnight)
5. Using the edges of the overhang parchment, lift the bars out of the pan and cut into 2 inch x 1 inch bars.
6. Garnish with a drizzle of caramel sauce and serve.
*Cool, store, label and rotate this item with older product correctly and diligently.

Related Products this prep gets used in:
Allergens: (to be filled out by nutrition) Method:
BUTTERNUT SQUASH FILLING:
* Process the squash;peel and remove seeds and pulp. Steam the squash untill fully cooked (fork tender) Using the robo coupe combine the squash untill pureed, mix in 350g of Ricota, milk,salt, and the nutmeg. Blend until creamy and smooth. Check for seasoning, adjust as needed.
SPINACH FILLING:
* steam out the spinach till vibrant green and wilted, squeeze out any exess moisture. Combine the cooked spinach, 350g of ricotta,150g of mozza, garlic, salt, and pepper. Mix together and taste for seasoning, adjust as needed.
COOK LASAGNE NOODLES TILL AL DENTE
ASSEMBLE:
1. In a hotel pan, LIGHTLY oil the bottom of the dish. spread 1/3 of the squash filling on the bottom of the pan. Sprinkle lightly with some of the reserved mozza,top with cooked lasagne noodles without overlaping.
2.spread half of the spinach mix over the noodles. sprinkle lightly with more mozza. Top with more cooked Noodles.
3. Spread another layer 1/3 of the squash mixture, sprinkle lightly with more mozza. Tope with cooked noodles
4.Spread the remaining half of the spinach mixture over the noodles. Sprinkle lightly with more mozza. Tope with noodles
5. Spread a generous amount of the squash filling (remaining 1/3) over the final layer of noodles top with remaining mozza and top with parmesan.
6. Sprinkle the oregano, paprika and basil.
7. Cover hotel pan with foil and bake @375 for 30 minutes; uncover and continue to bake for an aditional 10 minutes.
8. Allow to rest for at least 20 minutes before cutting to ensure a nice slice!
9. Garnish with Gremolata, Serve with kindness!
Hot hold/serve imediately.
*Cool, store, label and rotate this item with older product correctly and diligently

Allergens: Gluten/Dairy Method:
1.In a large Rondeau over medium-high heat, melt butter. Add the sausage and cook, stirring with a wooden spoon to break the meat into small clumps, until browned.
2.Transfer the sausage to a large mixing bowl, leaving the fat in the pan. Turn the heat down to medium, then add the onions to the pan along with 1 tablespoon of butter. Cook the onions, until soft and translucent,
3. Add the onions to the mixing bowl with the sausage, along with the bread cubes, grated cheese, green onions and parsley. Toss well, then spread the mixture evenly into the prepared baking pan.
4. In a seperate bowl, whisk together the eggs, cream, salt and pepper. Pour the egg mixture evenly over the bread mixture.
5. Cover tightly with saran wrap and refrigerate for at least a few hours (Best overnight)
6. Preheat the oven to 350°F. Bake for aprox. one hour, uncovered, until puffed and golden brown.
HOT HOLD/SERVE
**Note** The cook time is based on cooking the bread pudding directly out of the refrigerator. If it's left to sit out at room temperature before baking, check for doneness after 45 minutes.

***COOKS AND CHEFS, PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE RECIPE BEFORE BEGINNING- THIS IS A RECOMMENDED STEP WITH EVERY PRODUCT WE EVER PRODUCE- THANK YOU*** Amanda
Related Products this prep gets used in:
Allergens:Gluten, dairy Method:
1. Place a large saute pan over a low to medium-low heat. Add the 1 /2 of the oil followed by onion & garlic and reduce heat to low. Season with salt and pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, for 15 to 20 minutes, until the onions are golden brown.
2. Remove the onions from the pan and return the pan to the heat. Add the spinach and cook until wilted.
3. Remove from the spinach from the pan and leave to cool.
4. Increase the heat to medium/high and return the pan to the heat. Add the remaining oil and place the cleaned mushrooms, top side down. Cook until lightly golden (approx 5 minutes) before turning over and cooking for a further 5 minutes or until golden. Remove from the heat, and drain on paper towel top side up as they will release a lot of liquid as they cool.
5. Transfer the onions, spinach and mushrooms to the refrigerator and cool completely.
6. Preheat the oven to 390F. On a parchment lined pan place the puff pastry sheet on top. Spread half the caramelized onions over the middle third of the pastry, making sure to leave an extra 2cm border at the edge of the pastry. Top with half of the baby spinach. Spread the dijon mustard over the mushrooms and season well with salt and pepper. Place the mushrooms on top of the spinach. Top the mushrooms with thyme and the remaining baby spinach and onions.
7. Very carefully roll the pastry over the top of the mushroom mixture until you have a log. Press down to seal the edges. Roll over the log so that the seam is facing the bottom.
8. Whisk eggs together to make an egg wash . Very lightly coat the outside of the pastry log with the egg wash. Place the pastry in the freezer for 10 minutes before repeating with another layer of egg wash and freezing the pastry for a further 10 minutes.
9. Bake in the oven for 30 to 35 minutes, or until golden and flakey. Reserve for service.
*Cool, store, label and rotate this item with older product correctly and diligently

Utensils needed:

***COOKS AND CHEFS, PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE RECIPE BEFORE BEGINNING- THIS IS A RECOMMENDED STEP WITH EVERY PRODUCT WE EVER PRODUCE- THANK YOU*** Chef Amanda
Allergens: Dairy, Sulphites Method:
1.Coat the bottom of a large rondeau / tilt skillet with oil and put on medium heat until hot.
2. Season the chicken on both sides with salt and pepper and then brown, skin side down for about 15 minutes, until the skin is nice and crisp. Flip the chicken and cook for another 15 minutes, or until done. (The meat should read 165F) remove from rondeau and reserve.
3. Add the shallots and garlic to the rondeau and saute, stirring constantly, for a couple of minutes. Then add the white wine and let it bubble down while you scrape up the browned bits from the bottom of the pan.
4.. Melt the butter in the rondeau / tilt skillet and whisk in the flour to make a roux, cook out for 1 minute while constantly whisking. add chicken stock and heavy cream while whisking constantly to prevent lumps.
5. Add sun dried tomatoes, FRESH thyme and cook the sauce for a few minutes. Cook out until it starts to thicken, stirring frequently. Scrape up everything from the bottom and sides of the pan into the sauce.
6. Add the parmesan and stir until fully incorporated. Add the chopped spinach to the pan, and cook just until the spinach has wilted. Taste for seasoning and adjust as needed.
7. Add the chicken back into the rondeau/tilt skillet and heat through before serving. Ensure chicken is at 165F before serving.
*Cool, store, label and rotate this item with older product correctly and diligently

***COOKS AND CHEFS, PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE RECIPE BEFORE BEGINNING- THIS IS A RECOMMENDED STEP WITH EVERY PRODUCT WE EVER PRODUCE- THANK YOU*** Amanda
Related Products this prep gets used in:
Allergens: Gluten Method:
1.Combine the barley and stock: in a hotel pan. Add salt and pepper.
2. Cook In steamer. Keep an eye on the barley as it will give off a lot of foam at first and can boil over.
3. For pearl barley, start checking at 25 minutes. The barley is done when it has tripled in volume and is soft yet chewy. Add more water if the pan becomes dry before the barley has finished cooking; check every 5 minutes until desired chewiness is reached.
4. Drain the barley (if necessary): When the barley is done, it will have absorbed most of the water. If there is a little water still left in the pan, just leave the barley to sit for 10 minutes, covered, until it has all been absorbed. If there is a lot of water left, drain the barley in a strainer over the sink.
5. Fluff the barley! With a fork, fluff the barley to separate the grains. this is an imprtant step with all our steamed grains!

1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
2. Bake the crust for about 5 minutes.
3. Remove from the oven and allow to cool. The crust will be golden. but not not too dark. (as it will bake again with custard/filling
4. Prepare the egg custard mixture by adding the eggs to a large measuring cup. Add the heavy cream, then add the milk, salt and pepper.
5. Blend with a hand mixer to ensure the egg and cream mixture is completely homogenous (mixed thouroughly)
6. Spread the desired fillings on the bottom of the pie crust. Pour the egg mixture on top (leave a half CM of head space at the top of the quiche as the eggs will souffle and expand) Bake at 350 degrees for about 20-25 minutes (check after 15 mins) The quiche will be slightly wobbly in just the center.(this allows for carry over cooking and will set up within a few minutes of exiting the oven)
7. Allow to cool for about 20 minutes to room temperature. Quiche can be served warm, cold, or room temperature.

1. In a large pot bring enough water to cover beets to a boil. Add in beets and allow to simmer until beets are tender enough to be pierced with a fork, about 35-40 minutes.
2. Remove from pot and allow to cool completely. While running under cold water, remove the skins from the beets using a peeler. Cut beets into 2” pieces and set aside.
3.In a small bowl combine orange juice, orange zest, olive oil, cumin and salt. Stir well and set aside. In a large bowl add in beets, chopped fresh mint, fresh cilantro, sliced onions and dressing and toss until everything is mixed together. Top with more fresh herbs and serve.

1. Preheat the oven to 350F/177C. Grease and lightly flour 6 20.8”x12.8” (52.8 cm x 32.5 cm) half sheet/jelly roll pans. Set aside.
2. In a large mixing bowl and mixer with paddle attachment, cream the softened butter, then add sugar and beat until fluffy. Add eggs and vanilla, taking breaks to scrape down the sides of the bowl. Beat in the yogurt until fully combined.
3. In another large mixing bowl, whisk flour, baking soda, and salt together. Gradually take turns incorporating the dry ingredients and milk into the wet ingredients until combined and smooth. Do not overmix. Fold in the sprinkles.
4. Spread the cake batter into the greased pans, smoothing it into a thin, even layer with a rubber spatula. Bake for 20-24 minutes or until the top is lightly browned and a toothpick comes out clean. Remove the cakes from the oven and let them cool in the pan on a wire rack.

1. Using a stand mixer, cream the butter for 2 minutes until smooth.
2. Slowly add in confectioner sugar, milk, vanilla extract, and salt on low speed.
3. Change speed to high for 3 minutes and adjust for desired thickness (add milk if too thick or add confectioner sugar if too thin).
4. Spread the frosting over the cooled cake and top with rainbow sprinkles. Cut each cake to have 5 x 8 pieces (40 pieces of 2.5” x 2.5” total per pan).

Method:
1. Preheat oven to 400F

4. In large rondeau over medium heat melt the butter, whisk in the flour and form a roux, cook out while whisking 1-2 minutes

6. whisk in garlic powder, salt & pepper, onion powder, and nutmeg.

Top with remaining shredded mozza cheese and bread crumbs (persiallde)
10. Bake about 35 to 40 minutes or until golden, bubbly and the cheese has melted.

Method:
PREPARE THE FILLING:
1. Gather all ingredients
2. Preheat oven to 400F . lightly oil hotel pan (9x9")
3. Heat olive oil in rondeau. Add the onion, garlic, bell peppers,, cumin, and chili powder. Cook out untill the veggies are tender and the spices are toasted. 3-5 minutes aprox.

5. Blend the sour cream with the chipotle to make a sauce.
6. Cut the tortillas into 1/2" strips
ASSEMBLE:
1. Spread a little of the tomato sauce on the bottom. Layer half ot the tortila strips on the bottom to ensure full coverage allowing them to overlap.
2. Add half ot the veggie mix spreading out evenly. Drizzle the chipotle sour cream and half of the remaining tomato sauce. Spread evenly then sprinkle with half the cheese.
3. Repeat this layer again finishing with the reast of the cheese on top.
4. Cover with foil and bake for 15 minutes. Remove foil and bake for another 8-10 minutes. Until the casserole is hot and cooked all the way through and cheese is melted.
5. Allow to cool 5-10 minutes before cutting into squares.
6. Reserve for service / hot hold

Related Products this prep gets used in:
Method:
1.Rinse the lentils in cold water until the water runs clear.
2.Heat a large Rondeau or tilt skillet over medium-high heat and add the oil. Once the oil is shimmering, add the garlic, ginger, and Serrano pepper and cook for 2 minutes, stirring frequently to prevent garlic from burning.
3. Add the cumin, coriander, chili powder, curry powder, garam masala, salt, and black pepper to taste, and cook for 30 to 60 seconds until fragrant, tossing frequently to prevent burning. Add the ground turmeric now, along the the rest of the spices.
4. Pour in the vegetable broth, and use a wooden spoon or spatula to scrape up any browned bits on the bottom of the pot. Add in the lentils and the crushed tomatoes and mix well.
5. Reduce the heat to low and cover the pan with a lid. Simmer for 20 to 25 minutes, or until the lentils are cooked through and have mostly softened. If you find that the lentils are not quite soft after 25 minutes, add a bit more veg stock and cook for another 5 minutes.
6. Remove the lid and stir in the coconut milk.
7. Continue cooking on low heat, uncovered for 5 to 8 minutes, until the curry has thickened and is creamy.
8. Finally, stir in the lemon juice and cilantro, and turn off the heat.
9. Reserve for service.
*Cool, store, label and rotate this item with older product correctly and diligently

***COOKS AND CHEFS, PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE RECIPE BEFORE BEGINNING- THIS IS A RECOMMENDED STEP WITH EVERY PRODUCT WE EVER PRODUCE- THANK YOU*** Amanda
Related Products this prep gets used in:
Method:
1. Heat 1/2 of the oil in a large rondeau. Fry potatoes in hot oil until brown. Remove to a paper towel-lined tray to drain and reserve.
2. Add remaining oil to the rondeau and fry onions, garlic, and fresh ginger until onion is soft and golden. Add chili, pepper, turmeric, cumin, salt, and tomatoes. Fry, stirring constantly, for 5 minutes. Stir in yogurt, mint, ground cardamom, and cinnamon stick. Cover and cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, until the tomatoes are cooked to a pulp. It may be necessary to add a little hot water if the mixture becomes too dry and starts to stick to the pan.
3. When mixture is thick and smooth, add chicken and stir well to coat. Cover and cook over very low heat until chicken is tender, 30 to 35 minutes. There should only be a little very thick sauce left when the chicken is finished cooking. If necessary cook uncovered for a few minutes to reduce the sauce.
RICE:
1. Wash rice well and drain well for at least 30 minutes.
2. Heat remaining oil in a large rondeau. Fry onion in hot oil until golden. Add saffron, cardamom pods, cloves, cinnamon stick, ground ginger, and rice. Stir continuously until rice is coated with spices.
3. Heat stock and salt in a pot. When the mixture is hot, pour it over the rice and stir well. Add the chicken mixture and quartered potatoes; gently mix them into the rice. Bring to boil. Cover the saucepan tightly, turn heat to very low, and steam for 20 minutes. Do not lift lid or stir while cooking!
*Cool, store, label and rotate this item with older product correctly and diligently

***COOKS AND CHEFS, PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE RECIPE BEFORE BEGINNING- THIS IS A RECOMMENDED STEP WITH EVERY PRODUCT WE EVER PRODUCE- THANK YOU*** Amanda
Related Products this prep gets used in:
Method:
MARINATE THE CHICKEN
1. Put the chicken in a large bowl with the yogurt, turmeric and pinch of salt. Mix well. Chill for 2 hours, or preferably overnight.
CASHEW PASTE
2. Put 80g of cashews into a Vitamix, along with 110ml of hot water, ginger, and serrano peppers. Blitz to a smooth paste and reserve.
COOK THE CHICKEN
3. Heat the oil in a large rondeau over a medium heat, and sizzle the cinnamon and clove for 1 minute.
4. Add the onion and fry, stirring for 10-12 minutes until softened and turning golden brown. Add the chicken and left-over marinade and fry for 8 minutes, turning the chicken to seal as you go. Reduce the heat.
5. Add 100ml of water, cover and cook for 25 minutes, stirring halfway through.
6. Add the cashew paste, remove the lid and simmer for 5-7 minutes, or until the gravy has thickened slightly and just coats the chicken. Add the cardamom powder, stir into sauce and chicken. Cover and turn off the heat. let sit 5 minutes.
7. Heat the oil in a small pan. Fry the remaining cashews for 2-3 minutes or until starting to brown (DO NOT WALK AWAY DURING THIS PROCESS) Scoop into a bowl with a slotted spoon. Set aside. Add the mustard seeds and curry leaves to the pan. As soon as they begin to splutter, pour everything over the chicken, along with the cashew nuts. Ready to serve!
*Cool, store, label and rotate this item with older product correctly and diligently

Related Products this prep gets used in:
Method:
1. Heat 1/2 of the oil in a large rondeau. Fry potatoes in hot oil until brown. Remove to a paper towel-lined tray to drain and reserve.
2. Add remaining oil to the rondeau and fry onions, garlic, and fresh ginger until onion is soft and golden. Add chili, pepper, turmeric, cumin, salt, and tomatoes. Fry, stirring constantly, for 5 minutes. Stir in yogurt, mint, ground cardamom, and cinnamon stick. Cover and cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, until the tomatoes are cooked to a pulp. It may be necessary to add a little hot water if the mixture becomes too dry and starts to stick to the pan.
3. When mixture is thick and smooth, add Tofu and stir well to coat. Cover and cook over very low heat, 20 to 30 minutes. There should only be a little very thick sauce left when the biryani is finished cooking. If necessary cook uncovered for a few minutes to reduce the sauce.
RICE:
1. Wash rice well and drain well for at least 30 minutes.
2. Heat remaining oil in a large rondeau. Fry onion in hot oil until golden. Add saffron, cardamom pods, cloves, cinnamon stick, ground ginger, and rice. Stir continuously until rice is coated with spices.
3. Heat stock and salt in a pot. When the mixture is hot, pour it over the rice and stir well. Add the chicken mixture and quartered potatoes; gently mix them into the rice. Bring to boil. Cover the saucepan tightly, turn heat to very low, and steam for 20 minutes. Do not lift lid or stir while cooking!
*Cool, store, label and rotate this item with older product correctly and diligently

***COOKS AND CHEFS, PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE RECIPE BEFORE BEGINNING- THIS IS A RECOMMENDED STEP WITH EVERY PRODUCT WE EVER PRODUCE- THANK YOU***
Related Products this prep gets used in: Allergens: (to be filled out by nutrition) Method:
1. TO PREPARE THE WHEAT BERRIES: Combine the rinsed wheat berries with 33L water in a large pot or steam kettle. Bring to a rolliing boil over high heat, then cover, reduce heat and simmmer for 1 hour or until the wheat berries are pleasantly tender but still have some chew to them. Drain off excess water, return the wheat berries to the pot and stir in 3/4 cup salt. Set aside to cool
2. TO ROAST THE APPLES: Preheat oven to 425F. Cut the apples into wedges, making sure to remove the seeds. Toss them with oil and salt and pepper. Place apples on sheet tray with parchmen and arrange the apple wedges in a single layer. Bake the apples on the middle rack for 10 minutes, until they are starting to collapse on themselves but before they have burst open. Let the apple wedges cool on the pan before removing.
3. TO PREPARE THE SQUASH: Slice off the top and bottom ends of the squash, then slice it in half vertically. use a spoon to scoop out the seeds and discard them. Cut the squash in to 1/2" wide half-moon shaped bite size pieces. Transfer the squash to the large baking sheet and drizzle with ovlie oil. Toss until the squash is lightly coated in oil and sprinkle with salt. Arrange the squash in a single layer and roast for 30 minutes, tossing halfway, until the squash is tender and caramelized on the edges. Set asdide to cool. Cut
4. TO PREPARE THE DRESSING: In a small bowl, combine the olive oil, lemon juice, ginger, maple syrup, mustard and salt. Whisk until thoroughly blended and season to taste with ground black pepper.
5. TO ASSEMBLE THE SALAD: In a large serving bowl, add the arrugala, cooled wheat berries and apple wedges. Add the butternut squash, dried cranberries and pumpkin seeds, then drizzle with dressing. Toss to lightly coat. Serve immediately
*Cool, store, label and rotate this item with older product correctly and diligently

***COOKS AND CHEFS, PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE RECIPE BEFORE BEGINNING- THIS IS A RECOMMENDED STEP WITH EVERY PRODUCT WE EVER PRODUCE- THANK YOU***
Related Products this prep gets used in: Allergens: (to be filled out by nutrition) Method:
1. TO COOK GNOCCHI: Bring a large pot of water ro a boil and add salt to the water to the appropriate salinity for pasta cooking. Cook gnocchi for about 2 minutes or until they float to the top. Put gnocchi on sheet tray to cool.
2. TO PREPARE THE BUTTERNUT SQUASH: Preheat oven to 375F. Cut butternut squash in half lengthwise and scoop out seeds with a spoon. Coat squash with olive oil and season with salt and garlic powder. Place squash open-side down on a parchment lined baking tray. Bake for 45 minutes. Remove the squash from oven and allow it to cool in the fridge.
3. TO PREPARE SAUCE: Combine cornstarch with cold oat milk in a bowl to make a slurry. Set aside. Chiffonade sage leaves. Heat vegetable oil in a large saucepan. Put garlic cloves into a food processor with sage leaves. Pulse garlic and sage until coarsely minced. Once the oil is hot, add pre-minced garlic and sage. Sautee for 2 minutes. Combine 900ml of vegetable concentrate with 27L of water. Stir until mixed. Add vegetable stock, bottled lemon juice and cornstarch slurry to the garlic and sage saucepan. Stir until combined and the sauce begins to thicken. Scoop the chilled butternut squash from the peel using a spoon and add to the saucepan with the other ingredients. Reduce heat to low and simmer the sauce. Take an immersion blender and blend the sauce with squash until smooth with no large chunks of squash. Combined cooked gnochhi and blended sauce and stir until gnocchi is thoroughly coated in sauce. Take off the heat. Ready to serve.

Roast in Oven (preferred method for larger batches)
1.Preheat oven to 400ºF. Place whole poblano peppers on a baking sheet lined with parchment and roast for 35-40 minutes or until skins are blackened, flipping once.
2. Place peppers in a insert and wrap tightly with plastic wrap.Let cool for 10-15 minutes.
3. When cool enough to handle, peel off skins using your hands. Discard skin. Remove stems and seeds.
Grill
1. With grill heated to a high temperature, place poblano pepper directly on grill grates.
2. Use tongs to flip pepper occasionally, until the skin blackens and bubbles (3-4 minutes on each side). Don’t allow it to turn white or catch fire.
3. Place peppers in an insert and wrap tightly with plastic wrap, and let cool for 10-15 minutes.
When cool enough to handle, peel off skins using your hands. Discard skin.
* cool, store, label, wrap and rotate this item with older product correctly and diligently

***COOKS AND CHEFS, PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE RECIPE BEFORE BEGINNING- THIS IS A RECOMMENDED STEP WITH EVERY PRODUCT WE EVER PRODUCE- THANK YOU*** Chef Amanda
Method:
1. Grind spices. reserve. On a pachment lined baking sheet, roast the tomatillos in a 400F ove until splotchy black and thoroughly soft, about 5 minutes per side. Scrape into a large bowl. Add half of the the sesame seeds in with the tomatillos. Reserve the remainder for sprinkling on the chicken.
2. In a very large rondeau heat the veg oil over medium flame. When quite hot, fry the chiles, three or four pieces at a time, flipping them nearly constantly with tongs until their interior side has changed to a lighter color, about 20 or 30 seconds total frying time. Don’t toast them so darkly that they begin to smoke—that would make the mole bitter. As they’re done, remove them to a large bowl, being careful to drain as much fat as possible back into the pot. Cover the toasted chiles with hot tap water and let rehydrate 30 minutes, stirring frequently to insure even soaking.
3. Remove any stray chile seeds left in the fat. With the pot still over medium heat, fry the garlic and almonds, stirring regularly, until browned (the garlic should be soft), about 5 minutes. With a slotted spoon, remove to the tomatillo bowl, draining as much fat as possible back into the pot.
4. Add the raisins to the hot pot. Stir for 20 or 30 seconds, until they’ve puffed and browned slightly. Scoop them out, draining as much fat as possible back into the pot, and add to the tomatillos. Set the pan aside off the heat.To the tomatillo mixture, add the cinnamon, black pepper, anise, cloves, heavily toasted bread and chocolate. Add 2 cups water and stir to combine.
5. Into a large measuring cup, strain off the chiles’ soaking liquid. Taste the liquid: if it’s not bitter, discard all abut 6 cups of the liquid. (if you’re short, add water to make up the shortfall). If bitter, pour it out and measure 6 cups water. Scoop half of the chiles into a blende, pour in half of the soaking liquid (or water) and blend to a smooth puree.
6. Press through a medium-mesh strainer into a large bowl; discard the bits of skin and seeds that don’t pass through the strainer. Repeat with the remaining chiles.
7. Return the roneau to medium heat. When quite hot, pour in the chile puree; it should sizzle sharply and, if the pan is sufficiently hot, the mixture should never stop boiling. Stir every couple of minutes until the chile puree has darkened and reduced to the consistency of tomato paste, about a half hour.
8. In two batches, blend the tomatillo mixture as smoothly as possible (you may need an extra 250ml of water to keep everything moving through the blades), then strain it in to the large bowl that contained the chiles. When the chile paste has reduced, add the tomatillo mixture to the pot and cook, stirring every few minutes until considerably darker and thicker, 15 to 20 minutes.
9. Simmer. Add the broth to the pot and briskly simmer the mixture over medium to medium-low heat for about 2 hours for all the flavors to come together and mellow. If the mole has thickened beyond the consistency of a cream soup, stir in a little water. Taste and season with salt and the sugar. Taste for seasoning, adjust as necassary
*Cool, store, label and rotate this item with older product correctly and diligently

4. Raise the oven temperature to 400 degrees. Strain off the juices that have collected around the chicken, then brush the pieces liberally with the glossy mole mixture. Sprinkle with the reserved sesame seeds. Bake for 10 minutes to set the glaze.
5. Remove from the oven, let stand at room temperature for 10 minutes, then move to warmer and hold for service. NO longer than 2 hours.
6. Serve each portion of chicken with about 60ml of warm mole.

2. In the til skillet or large rondeau; Toast the chiles in the skillet: 1 or 2 at a time, open them flat and press down firmly on the hot surface with a spatula; when you smell them toasting and they start crackling turn them over and toast the other side. DO NOT OVER TOAST!

Blend to a smooth puree, scraping and stirring every few seconds. (If the mixture just won’t go through the blender blades, add a little more liquid.) Press through a medium-mesh strainer into a bowl.
5. Heat half (25ml) of the oil in a heavy pot over medium-high.When the oil is hot enough to make a drop of the puree sizzle sharply, add the puree and stir constantly until it reduces into a thick paste, 5 to 7 minutes.
6. Stir in the remaining 750ml stock, partially cover and simmer over medium-low, stirring occasionally, 20 to 30 minutes for the flavors to come together.
7. Add the hot sauce and, if necessary, stir in a little more stock to bring the sauce to a medium, saucy consistency.
8. Taste and season with salt and the sugar.
9. In a large skillet, melt the butter with the remaining oil over medium-high heat.
10. Add the prawns and cook, stirring, for 1 minute.
11. Add the remaining onion, breaking the rings apart, and cook, stirring, until the shrimp are done and the onion is beginning to soften, 2 to 3 minutes.
12. Add the sauce and stir everything together until the sauce is boiling. Remove from heat and serve.

4. Add the riced cauliflower, corn and drained beans to the skillet. Stir, stir, stir until the rice is worked into the skillet ingredients.
5. Continue sautéing, stirring occasionally, until the cauliflower releases its moisture and is cooked through, but not completely soft. Be sure to stir frequently so the cauliflower cooks evenly.
6. Once cooked through, remove from heat and stir in the lime juice and cilantro. Taste for seasoning, and adjust as needed with salt, lime juice, or cilantro.
7. NOTE: about texture – depending on the size of the cauliflower rice and how much moistures it contains, the cooking time will vary. The best way to know the rice is cooked is to taste it. Fully cooked cauliflower rice will be chewy, but still a bit firm with a light bite. Overcooked cauliflower rice can be soggy, so pay attention to the pan and start tasting for texture around the 5-minute mark.

***COOKS AND CHEFS, PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE RECIPE BEFORE BEGINNING- THIS IS A RECOMMENDED STEP WITH EVERY PRODUCT WE EVER PRODUCE- THANK YOU*** Chef Amanda
Method:
1. Peel the plantains and cut them into 1-inch thick coins.
2. Place in a pot, cover them with cold water, add salt, bring to a boil, and then reduce heat to simmer. Cook until a fork easily slides in and out when you poke a piece of plantain, about 10-15 minutes.
3. Drain the plantains and let them cool until you can handle them.
4. Place the chunks between two pieces of parchment paper or plastic wrap and lightly smash them with a meat hammer. You want to smush ’em up just enough to make some rough edges; they don’t need to be particularly thin.
5. Heat a large, rondeau or tilt skillet over medium-high heat and warm the oil. (DO NOT PUT IN THE DEEP FRYER)
6. Add the smashed plantains and brown them on both sides, about 3-5 minutes per side. Sprinkle with a little salt while still hot.
7. Reserve for service.
NOTE: The plantains can be boiled and smashed in advance, then stored in the fridge until you’re ready to crisp them in the pan.

***COOKS AND CHEFS, PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE RECIPE BEFORE BEGINNING- THIS IS A RECOMMENDED STEP WITH EVERY PRODUCT WE EVER PRODUCE- THANK YOU*** Chef Amanda
Related Products this prep gets used in: Falda de Res Asada en Adobo
Method:
1. Toast and soak the chiles. Heat a rondeau over medium heat and, a few at a time, toast the chiles, pressing them flat against the hot surface for several seconds with a metal spatula until they change colour and release their aroma, then flipping and toasting the other side. Collect into a bowl, cover with hot tap water, weight with a plate to keep them submerged and rehydrate for 20 to 30 minutes. Remove and discard water.
2. Heat the oil in a large pot set over medium-high. Add the onion and garlic and stir for 5 minutes or so, until the onion is browned a little, but not completely soft.
3. Remove the pan from the heat and using a slotted spoon, transfer the onion and garlic to a blender or food processor, squeezing them to leave behind as much fat as possible.
4. Transfer the chiles from their soaking liquid to the blender, add in the cumin, black pepper and oregano.
5. Add 700ml of Veg stock and blend/process until as smooth as possible.
6. Set the saucepan back over medium-high heat and when the fat is hot enough to make a drop of puree sizzle sharply, set a medium-mesh strainer over the pot and press the puree through. Stir for 7 or 8 minutes, until it is darker in color and very thick. Add the remaining stock, the orange juice and the vinegar. Simmer, partially covered, for 30 minutes or longer to bring the flavors together.
7. Reserve
*Cool, store, label and rotate this item with older product correctly and diligently

***COOKS AND CHEFS, PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE RECIPE BEFORE BEGINNING- THIS IS A RECOMMENDED STEP WITH EVERY PRODUCT WE EVER PRODUCE- THANK YOU*** Chef Amanda
Related Products this prep gets used in: Allergens: (to be filled out by nutrition) Method:
1. Gather and scale out all ingredients
2. Preheat oven to 375F Line hotel pan with parchment paper.
3. Mix all seasonings untli well combined and "clumps"
4. Toss the chickpeas with the olive oil until well coated, then toss the oiled chickpeas with the spice mix.
5. Place on baking sheet in a single layer and not overcrowding (leave some spaces between so the crisp and not steam!
6. Bake in oven for aproxamitley 20 minutes until crispy and golden.
7. allow to cool on sheet tray and ensure chikpeas are FULLY cooled before transfering to a sealed container with a piece of paper towel to absorb any moisture.
8. Taste for seasoning, while warm you can add a bit more seasoning if needed
** PRO TIPS: make in small batches and don't put too many in one container, also make as close to service as possible, making too far in advance leads to a poor product; they will lose their "cripspyness" and become chewy.
*Cool, store, label and rotate this item with older product correctly and diligently

***COOKS AND CHEFS, PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE RECIPE BEFORE BEGINNING- THIS IS A RECOMMENDED STEP WITH EVERY PRODUCT WE EVER PRODUCE- THANK YOU*** Chef Amanda
Related Products this prep gets used in: Allergens: (to be filled out by nutrition) Method:
1. Gently mix the flour, salt and oil together in a large bowl. Gradually add the WARM water and mix to form a sticky. soft dough.
2. Transfer the dough to a clean, lightly floured surface. Knead until the dough becomes smooth and elastic. !0 - 15 minutes. Return the dough to the bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and let sit in warm place for 20-30 minutes.
3. Transfer the dough to a lightly floured surface and divide into 45g balls. Roll into balls with your hands. then roll with a rolling pin into a very thin round disc.
4. Heat flat top on high. Place Chipati disc onto hot surface and let it cook undisturbed for a few seconds. brush the top with a thin layer of oil with a pastry brush. When bubbles apear on the surface, flip and brush other side with oil.
5. Flip 1 or 2 more times until each side is golden brown and dough is now fully cooked.
6. Serve warm
